intro: Alternanthera sessilis var. nodiflora, commonly known as the red-leaf alternanthera, is a species of flowering plant in the Amaranthaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of South America and is characterized by its striking red or purple foliage. The plant typically grows as an herbaceous perennial, often reaching heights of 30 to 60 centimeters. Its leaves are opposite and sessile, with a velvety texture that enhances its ornamental appeal. It produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are clustered in spikes, typically blooming in late summer.
